intro: Fedia incrassata, commonly known as the broad-leaved fedia, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in woodland and forested areas, preferring well-drained soils. Fedia incrassata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
